LanguageData.VV_DragonFruitPlant.description: A cactus-like plant producing large, colorful fruits. Dragon fruit grows slowly but provides a nutritious and visually striking harvest for the colony.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Dragonfruit plants grow 30% faster in equatorial regions. The size of the equatorial region depends on the planet's overall temperature: below 15ยบ for Normal, below 35ยบ for Warm, below 65ยบ for Hot and all the planet for Very Hot. Planets with below Normal temperature are considered to have no equator.
LanguageData.VV_AmaranthPlant.description: A vibrant leafy plant with tiny edible seeds. Amaranth grows quickly and yields reliably, making it a practical choice for steady food production.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Amaranth plants have adapted to drought conditions so well that they recieve a 70% growth penalty when grown within 10 tiles of water.
LanguageData.VV_MilletPlant.description: A fast-growing cereal crop valued for its resilience. Millet tolerates poor soil and dry conditions better than most food plants, making it a reliable fallback in harsh environments. While the harvest is modest, its short growing time ensures a steady food supply.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Millet plants have adapted to drought conditions so well that they recieve a 70% growth penalty when grown within 10 tiles of water.
LanguageData.VV_ArtichokePlant.description: A large, slow-growing plant yielding edible flower buds. Artichokes require patience but offer reliable harvests for the colony.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Artichoke plants are very resistant to damage. They take less damage from prolonged lack of light, and will regenerate damage caused by any other means.
LanguageData.VV_AsparagusPlant.description: A slow-growing vegetable harvested for its tender green shoots. Asparagus matures over an extended period and provides a modest, reliable harvest for the farm.\n\n<color=#E5E54C>Gameplay effect:</color> Artichoke plants are very resistant to damage. They take less damage from prolonged lack of light, and will regenerate damage caused by any other means.
